isis.stitle: CALIPER DISC BRAKES - SERVICE PROCEDURES - SINGLE PISTON CALIPER (CODE 04145)

step1.para: Take a new piston seal and dip the seal in clean brake fluid. Install seal into piston bore. Seal groove by holding seal in groove and gently working seal around into groove. Make sure that the seal is not twisted or rolled. Never use an old seal.
Using the piston installer tool, assemble a new boot on tool as shown ( Figure 32). The tool should expand only the lip of the boot that fits in the groove of the piston. Refer to SPECIAL TOOLS.

figure.caption: Figure 32. Piston Installation Tool and New Dust Boot (Single Piston)

step1.para: Position dust boot with piston installer tool into piston caliper bore. Insert bottom of boot into groove at top edge of caliper bore ( Figure 33).

figure.caption: Figure 33. Place Installer Tool and Dust Boot Over Cylinder Bore (Single Piston)

step1.para: Apply brake fluid to the outside surface of the piston. Then place piston into piston installer tool and piston bore. Using a suitable tool such as the end of a hammer handle, gently push piston past piston seal and bottom piston ( Figure 34). Remove tool and make sure that the lip of the boot is seated in the top groove of the piston. The piston can also be installed by using a "C" clamp inserted into the piston opening (hole) and the back of the caliper. Once piston is more than half way installed, remove "C" clamp and complete piston installation by using a hammer handle as described earlier in this step.

figure.caption: Figure 34. Installation of Piston In Caliper Bore (Single Piston)

step1.para: If piston installer is not available, the dust boot can be installed as follows.

step2.para: Start dust boot onto the inboard end of the piston.
Insert boot and piston into piston bore. Using a small screwdriver work the boot seal into the groove in the piston bore. Use care so that the boot is not damaged.
Using the end of a hammer handle inserted into the piston opening (hole), push piston past seal and bottom piston in bore. Make sure that the lip of the boot is in the groove of the piston.

step1.para: Install caliper and pad assembly as outlined in PADS AND CALIPER INSTALLATION .
